content.description: This has a chain draw or two, as the rock was eating in to nylon draws in those locations. It has good quality rock with varied movement and fun climbing. There is a high first bolt consider stick clipping. There should be sticks along the base, bring your own tape or skillz.
content.protection: 6 bolts plus anchor bolts, you can take it over the lip if you want to walk off or lower off from up there (not recommended).
content.location: This is in the middle of the wall just to the right of the large scoop. Look for the chain draws.

content.description: Start on the left side of the dark intrusion working over to the right. There is some exfoliation on the face though all chalked and obvious holds are solid. It is a good warm-up for the climbs to the right.
content.location: This route is the farthest left route on the wall. Go a bit past the talus field, and watch out for wild roses.

content.description: Start on small crimps off of a platform on the bush. Climb slightly left of the first couple bolts before entering the white rock and sharper holds before a lunge/thrown to the lip with mellow climbing to the chains.
content.protection: 6 bolts will see you to the top.
content.location:
It is just left of

Four Walls

and two to the right of

Staring Down The Sun

(identifiable by chain draws).

content.description:
This is an open project just to the right of

Four Walls

. It traverses on thin crimps out the right side of the roof.
content.protection: A stick clip is certainly recommended for the first bolt as it's a high one. Otherwise, it's about 7-ish bolts out to either a walk off or a bolted anchor.

content.description: Four Walls has a few cruxes with a hard move off the ground and a mantle or two to keep it interesting. It is a super varied and fun route with clean falls. There is some dirt on the ledge.
content.protection: 5 bolts plus anchor bolts (walk off suggested).
content.location: It is to the right of Priest on a Playground by 7-8 feet, at the top of the trail.

content.description:
The crux is after the crack. The crack starts at perfect hands and widens gradually. The crux is protected by the new bolt. The route was sent onsight, ground up,

sans

bolt, but after considering the potential fall, I made the choice to add it to make the route safer. You don't of course have to clip it if you wish to do it in the original style.
content.protection: Fingers to wide hands (#4 Friends). There are anchor bolts up top. Consider some longer slings.
content.location:
Left of

Staring Down The Sun

, this starts in the obvious hand crack.

content.description: This was onsighted ground up by Angus and myself on the 4th of July. Lots of dirt and choss came out of this thing, leaving it less dirty. A fun fact on the FA is that Angus used a carabiner as a chock behind the chockstone, it was bomber.
content.protection: It will take the wide stuff, 5s & 6s. There are anchor bolts at the top.
content.location: This is the far right, obvious offwidth. You can walk off to the right or lower off.
